section.name: WADI - Web Application Distribution Infrastructure
section.p: WADI is an acronym of 'Web Application Distribution Infrastructure'.

WADI's aim is to resolve many of the problems of dealing with state in the clustered J2EE Web Tier. This involves technologies such as :
A resolution to application vs container space concurrency issues surrounding HttpSessions
HttpSession Migration (inter-node and node-store-node)
Pluggable HttpSession serialisation strategies - per-session, per-attribute
HttpRequest relocation (by redirection and proxying)
Pluggable/Stackable HttpSession persistance mechanisms (File, Database, etc.)
A scalable, self-partitioning, self-healing clustering substrate - a distributed index/map
NYI - Efficient in-vm replication for HA state
NYI - pluggable replication strategies - immediate, end-of-request-group, timed

WADI currently supports the following J2EE web containers:
Tomcat 5.0.28+, 5.5.X
Jetty 5.1.3+, 6.X
WADI-2.0 is a complete rearchitecture and rewrite. New documentation is being entered into the WADI Wiki. We hope to have a 2.0 release out shortly.
Please use the Getting Started Page to boostrap yourself into WADI's world.
Please browse our FAQ for further details.
If you have problems or concerns with WADI, ask on the users mailing list or join us on irc at <irc://irc.codehaus.org> on #wadi.
